accessRole.externalId.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Users/Roles > Manage Roles. This value sets the role assigned to this partner.
accessRole.externalId.name: accessRole.externalId

accessRole.internalId.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Users/Roles > Manage Roles. This value sets the role assigned to this partner.
accessRole.internalId.name: accessRole.internalId

accessRole.name.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Users/Roles > Manage Roles. This value sets the role assigned to this partner.
accessRole.name.name: accessRole.name

altName.description: This is the name of this person or company.
altName.name: altName

bcn.description: If this partner is located in Canada, enter the partner's business number.
bcn.name: bcn

comments.description: Enter any other information you want to note about this partner.
comments.name: comments

companyName.description: Required on Add when the isPerson field is set to FALSE.
companyName.name: companyName

customForm.externalId.description: References an existing custom form for this record type. To ensure that field relationships defined within a desired custom form are maintained, you must provide the customForm value. Also, if defaults are off, then customForm is required, if defaults are on then the default form is used. Internal ID values for existing forms can be found at Setup > Customization > Entry Forms. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
customForm.externalId.name: customForm.externalId

customForm.internalId.description: References an existing custom form for this record type. To ensure that field relationships defined within a desired custom form are maintained, you must provide the customForm value. Also, if defaults are off, then customForm is required, if defaults are on then the default form is used. Internal ID values for existing forms can be found at Setup > Customization > Entry Forms. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
customForm.internalId.name: customForm.internalId

customForm.name.description: References an existing custom form for this record type. To ensure that field relationships defined within a desired custom form are maintained, you must provide the customForm value. Also, if defaults are off, then customForm is required, if defaults are on then the default form is used. Internal ID values for existing forms can be found at Setup > Customization > Entry Forms. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
customForm.name.name: customForm.name

defaultAddress.description: This field automatically shows the default billing address that you enter and add using the Address subtab.
defaultAddress.name: defaultAddress

defaultTaxReg.externalId.description: Select the default tax registration number for this entity.
defaultTaxReg.externalId.displayName: Default Tax Reg. Number - External id
defaultTaxReg.externalId.name: defaultTaxReg.externalId

defaultTaxReg.internalId.description: Select the default tax registration number for this entity.
defaultTaxReg.internalId.displayName: Default Tax Reg. Number - Internal id
defaultTaxReg.internalId.name: defaultTaxReg.internalId

defaultTaxReg.name.description: Select the default tax registration number for this entity.
defaultTaxReg.name.name: defaultTaxReg.name

department.externalId.description: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Departments. This field is required when Make Departments Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.
department.externalId.name: department.externalId

department.internalId.description: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Departments. This field is required when Make Departments Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.
department.internalId.name: department.internalId

department.name.description: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Departments. This field is required when Make Departments Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.
department.name.name: department.name

eligibleForCommission.description: Check this box if you want this partner to be able to earn commission or royalties. Partners must be assigned to a partner commission plan before they can earn commission.
eligibleForCommission.name: eligibleForCommission

email.description: Sets the email address for this partner. Must be a standard well-formed address. Required when giveAccess is set to TRUE.
email.name: email

emailPreference.value.description: References a value in a system generated list. Options include _default, _hTML or _pDF.
emailPreference.value.name: emailPreference.value

entityId.description: The name of the partner record. Required on add and update.
entityId.name: entityId

fax.description: Enter a fax number for this record. You should enter the fax number exactly as it must be dialed. If a '1' is required to fax to this number, be sure to include it at the beginning of the number.The number you enter here automatically appears in the To Be Faxed field of transactions when you select this customer.To fax NetSuite forms, an administrator must first set up fax service at Setup > Set Up Printing, Fax and E-mail > Fax.
fax.name: fax

giveAccess.description: Set to TRUE to give the partner access to NetSuite. Set the role for the partner in the accessRole field.
giveAccess.name: giveAccess

globalSubscriptionStatus.value.description: Email recipients can have one of four subscription statuses:    * Confirmed Opt-In - When an email recipient has indicated that they want to receive your campaign messages, they are assigned this subscription status. Only a recipient can set his or her subscription status to Confirmed Opt-In.    * Soft Opt-In - Recipients with this status can receive opt-in messages that enable them to confirm whether or not they want to receive your email campaigns as well as email marketing campaigns.      You can set a recipient’s status to Soft Opt-In manually or through a mass update.    * Soft Opt-Out - Recipients with this status cannot receive campaign email messages but can receive opt-in messages.      You can change this subscription status to Soft Opt-In manually or through a mass update.    * Confirmed Opt-Out - Only the recipient can set their subscription status to Confirmed Opt-Out.      Recipients with this status cannot receive email campaigns or opt-in messages. Recipients with this status can only opt in again through the Partner Center or by clicking the link in a campaign message they have received prior to opting out.
globalSubscriptionStatus.value.name: globalSubscriptionStatus.value

image.externalId.description: Select an image from your file cabinet to attach to this record.Select -New- to upload a new image from your hard drive to your file cabinet in a new window.
image.externalId.name: image.externalId

image.internalId.description: Select an image from your file cabinet to attach to this record.Select -New- to upload a new image from your hard drive to your file cabinet in a new window.
image.internalId.name: image.internalId

image.name.description: Select an image from your file cabinet to attach to this record.Select -New- to upload a new image from your hard drive to your file cabinet in a new window.
image.name.name: image.name

isInactive.description: When you check this box, this partner no longer appears on the Partners list unless you check the Show Inactives box at the bottom of the page.Also, you can no longer select this partner from any lists on transactions, contact records, task records or event records.
isInactive.name: isInactive

isPerson.description: By default, this is set to True which specifies the type of partner record as Individual. If set to False, the partner record is set as a Company type.
isPerson.name: isPerson

location.externalId.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Locations.
location.externalId.name: location.externalId

location.internalId.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Locations.
location.internalId.name: location.internalId

location.name.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Locations.
location.name.name: location.name

partnerCode.description: If not provided, defaults to the value set for companyName when isPerson is set to FALSE or Name when isPerson is set to TRUE.
partnerCode.name: partnerCode

password.description: Sets the password assigned to allow this customer access to NetSuite. The password must meet password policy requirements for this account. For more information, see the help topic NetSuite Password Requirements.
password.name: password

password2.description: Sets the password confirmation field. Required when the giveAccess field is set to TRUE
password2.name: password2

phone.description: Enter a phone number for this partner.This number appears in the Partners list.This field is required for the Online Bill Pay feature.
phone.name: phone

phoneticName.description: Enter the furigana character you want to use to sort this record.
phoneticName.name: phoneticName

printOnCheckAs.description: Sets the Pay to the Order of line of a check instead of what you entered in the Partner field.
printOnCheckAs.name: printOnCheckAs

referringUrl.description: This is a read-only field that provides the URL of your home page with the partner ID parameter added.
referringUrl.name: referringUrl

requirePwdChange.description: If set to TRUE, the partner is required to change the assigned password on the next login attempt.
requirePwdChange.displayName: Require Password Change On Next Login
requirePwdChange.name: requirePwdChange

salutation.description: Enter the appropriate salutation for this partner.
salutation.name: salutation

sendEmail.description: This field can only be set on ADD. When set to TRUE, an email notification is sent to the Partner to inform them that they have been granted access to your account.
sendEmail.name: sendEmail

subPartnerLogin.description: If set to TRUE, this partner can create subpartner records and give them access to NetSuite.
subPartnerLogin.displayName: Can give login access to sub-partners
subPartnerLogin.name: subPartnerLogin

subsidiary.externalId.description: Select the subsidiary to associate with this partner. You cannot enter transactions for this partner unless a subsidiary is assigned. If you select this customer on a transaction, the transaction is associated with this subsidiary. The partner is able to access only information associated with this subsidiary. Note: Once a transaction has posted for the partner, you are not able to change the subsidiary selected on the partner record.
subsidiary.externalId.name: subsidiary.externalId

subsidiary.internalId.description: Select the subsidiary to associate with this partner. You cannot enter transactions for this partner unless a subsidiary is assigned. If you select this customer on a transaction, the transaction is associated with this subsidiary. The partner is able to access only information associated with this subsidiary. Note: Once a transaction has posted for the partner, you are not able to change the subsidiary selected on the partner record.
subsidiary.internalId.name: subsidiary.internalId

subsidiary.name.description: Select the subsidiary to associate with this partner. You cannot enter transactions for this partner unless a subsidiary is assigned. If you select this customer on a transaction, the transaction is associated with this subsidiary. The partner is able to access only information associated with this subsidiary. Note: Once a transaction has posted for the partner, you are not able to change the subsidiary selected on the partner record.
subsidiary.name.name: subsidiary.name

taxIdNum.description: Enter the partner's tax ID number.This is necessary if you are required to issue a 1099 form.
taxIdNum.name: taxIdNum

type.value.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Locations.
type.value.name: type.value

url.description: Only available when isPerson is set to FALSE.
url.name: url

vatRegNumber.description: For the UK edition only. Note that this field is not validated when submitted via Web services.
vatRegNumber.name: vatRegNumber
